docs.abstract: Drew Houston, chief executive of Dropbox, is set to become a member of a small club of entrepreneurs who steered a start-up through to the public markets.
docs.snippet: Drew Houston, chief executive of Dropbox, is set to become a member of a small club of entrepreneurs who steered a start-up through to the public markets.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — When Drew Houston played computer games like Starcraft in high school, he made some changes so the games ran more smoothly on his friends’ computers.

headline.main: Dropbox Chief to Join Elite Ranks of Idea-to-I.P.O. Founders
headline.print_headline: At Dropbox, From an Idea To the Market

docs.abstract: The network lets advertisers know they are welcome to get in on the act during its presentation in New York.
docs.snippet: The network lets advertisers know they are welcome to get in on the act during its presentation in New York.
docs.lead_paragraph: The major networks are unveiling their latest wares to ad buyers in Manhattan this week at a series of events known as the Upfront presentations. It’s a longtime tradition made more urgent, these days, by the exodus of advertisers over the last few years from television to Facebook and Google. Two New York Times reporters who cover the media — John Koblin (television) and Sapna Maheshwari (advertising) — assess what they saw during the ABC presentation at Lincoln Center’s David Geffen Hall on Tuesday.

headline.main: ABC Plays Up ‘Roseanne’ and Product Placement at Annual Presentation

byline.original: By John Koblin and Sapna Maheshwari

docs.abstract: Six weeks after firing the former congressman, Morgan Stanley said the dismissal wasn’t due to sexual misconduct. Mr. Ford had been a polarizing figure at the bank.
docs.snippet: Six weeks after firing the former congressman, Morgan Stanley said the dismissal wasn’t due to sexual misconduct. Mr. Ford had been a polarizing figure at the bank.
docs.lead_paragraph: Six weeks after firing the former congressman Harold E. Ford Jr. for unspecified misconduct, Morgan Stanley clarified Monday that the misconduct was not sexual in nature.

headline.main: Morgan Stanley Says Harold Ford Jr. Wasn’t Fired for Sexual Misconduct
headline.print_headline: Sexual Misconduct Not Basis For Ford’s Firing, Bank Says

docs.abstract: With 164,000 jobs added in April, it was the 91st consecutive month of gains, far and away the longest streak of increases on record.
docs.snippet: With 164,000 jobs added in April, it was the 91st consecutive month of gains, far and away the longest streak of increases on record.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Labor Department released its April hiring and unemployment report on Friday, providing the latest snapshot of the economy.

headline.main: Unemployment Rate Hits 3.9%, a Rare Low, as Job Market Becomes More Competitive

docs.abstract: Democrats at the bipartisan meeting voiced support for the president’s proposal to restrict imports of steel and aluminum, while Republicans urged caution.
docs.snippet: Democrats at the bipartisan meeting voiced support for the president’s proposal to restrict imports of steel and aluminum, while Republicans urged caution.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump suggested on Tuesday that the United States was likely to impose restrictions on imported metals, reviving the prospects for a continuing investigation whose future has been called into question amid months of pushback and delays.

headline.main: Trump Tells Lawmakers He’s Mulling Limits on Imported Steel
headline.print_headline: Trump Says He’s Leaning Toward Steel Import Limits

docs.abstract: The merger partners will struggle to match Comcast’s offer for Sky, but Disney might conclude it’s crucial to its expansion and Rupert Murdoch will be reluctant to part with a company he spent decades building.
docs.snippet: The merger partners will struggle to match Comcast’s offer for Sky, but Disney might conclude it’s crucial to its expansion and Rupert Murdoch will be reluctant to part with a company he spent decades building.
docs.lead_paragraph: Deals rarely look as good on paper as they do in a chief executive’s head. Comcast’s $31 billion offer for the British satellite broadcaster Sky just about passes financial muster. Investors expecting a higher bid from Rupert Murdoch’s 21st Century Fox, with backing from the Walt Disney Company’s boss, Robert A. Iger, are betting on the triumph of sentiment over spreadsheet.

headline.main: Investors Bet That Fox and Disney Will Toss Financial Sense Aside

docs.abstract: Our photographer drove through parts of Wisconsin, Illinois and Missouri before Starbucks closed its stores Tuesday, trying to capture the cultural force that the company has become.
docs.snippet: Our photographer drove through parts of Wisconsin, Illinois and Missouri before Starbucks closed its stores Tuesday, trying to capture the cultural force that the company has become.
docs.lead_paragraph: When Starbucks shuts down across the United States, it’s hard not to take notice.

headline.main: Starbucks, at the Intersection of Race and Class in America
headline.print_headline: Where Race, Class And Starbucks Meet

docs.abstract: Amazon and Google have filed patent applications, many still under consideration, that outline how digital assistants can monitor more of what users say and do.
docs.snippet: Amazon and Google have filed patent applications, many still under consideration, that outline how digital assistants can monitor more of what users say and do.
docs.lead_paragraph: Amazon ran a commercial on this year’s Super Bowl that pretended its digital assistant Alexa had temporarily lost her voice. It featured celebrities like Rebel Wilson, Cardi B and even the company’s chief executive, Jeff Bezos.

headline.main: Hey, Alexa, What Can You Hear? And What Will You Do With It?
headline.print_headline: Hey, Alexa, What Can You Hear? And What Will You Do With It?

docs.abstract: They may keep passengers happy, but the entertainment systems are expensive and add bulk and weight to the seats. Plus, travelers are bringing their own devices.
docs.snippet: They may keep passengers happy, but the entertainment systems are expensive and add bulk and weight to the seats. Plus, travelers are bringing their own devices.
docs.lead_paragraph: Airlines have been shrinking their seats for a long time, aiming to reduce the planes’ weight and squeeze in more passengers. But lately, some carriers have been going one step further in redesigning their seats: They’re taking away the seatback screens.

headline.main: Those Seatback Screens on Planes Are Starting to Disappear
headline.print_headline: Back of the Seat May Soon Lose Your Attention

docs.abstract: Facebook’s chief executive spoke with The New York Times about data privacy of users, Cambridge Analytica and the company’s next steps.
docs.snippet: Facebook’s chief executive spoke with The New York Times about data privacy of users, Cambridge Analytica and the company’s next steps.
docs.lead_paragraph: For much of the past week, Facebook has been embroiled in a controversy involving Cambridge Analytica, a political consulting firm with ties to Donald J. Trump’s 2016 presidential campaign, and how the firm improperly obtained and exploited personal data from 50 million Facebook users.

headline.main: Mark Zuckerberg’s Reckoning: ‘This Is a Major Trust Issue’

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Russian Interference in 2016 US Elections and Ties to Trump Associates

byline.original: By Kevin Roose and Sheera Frenkel
